Sentence.sentence: Tennessee's technical and community colleges will not outsource ( ' , 外包) management of their facilities to a private company, a decision one leader said was bolstered by an analysis of spending at each campus.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Morgan said those findings—which included data from the system's 13 community colleges, 27 technical colleges and six universities—were part of the decision not to move forward with Governor Bill Haslam's proposal to privatize management of state buildings in an effort to save money.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Morgan notified the Haslam administration of his decision to opt out in a letter sent last week.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This might not be right, but school-leavers who fail to acknowledge as much risk making the wrong decision about going to university.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The prestige of the university influences employers' recruitment decisions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It has little impact on their decision whether or not to quit smoking.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Any veteran nicotine addict will testify that fancy packaging plays no role in the decision to keep smoking.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: We help guide people to critical resources and counsel them on life-changing decisions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The third element of love in Sternberg’s theory is what he calls decision commitment, the decision that one is in a love relationship, the willingness to label it as such and the commitment to maintain that relationship at least for some period of time.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And he has a theory of love that argues that it’s made up of three components: intimacy,passion and commitment, or what is sometimes called decision commitment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: We worry most about now because if we don't survive for the next minute, we're not going to be around in ten years' time, says Professor Elke Weber of the Centre for Research on Environmental Decisions at Columbia University in New York.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: We should take our future into consideration in making decisions concerning climate change before it is too late.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Traditionally, guidelines have heavily influenced the practice of medicine, and the latest ones are expected to make doctors more conscious of the economic consequences of their decisions, even though there's no obligation to follow them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This is a very sensible way for an animal to make decisions in the wild and would have been very helpful for humans for thousands of years.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They argue that governments should persuade us into making better decisions - such as saving more in our pension plans - by changing the default options.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Take costs into account when making treatment decisions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Saying they can no longer ignore the rising prices of health care, some of the most influential medical groups in the nation are recommending that doctors weigh the costs, not just the effectiveness of treatments, as they make decisions about patient care.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Our society depends on them being able to make critical decisions about their own medical treatment say, or what we must do about global energy needs and demands.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One of the ways in which all agents seem to make decisions is that they assign a lower weighting to outcomes that are going to be further away in the future, he says.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is the government's responsibility to persuade people into making environment-friendly decisions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the extreme, some critics have said that making treatment decisions based on cost is a form of rationing.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Hall's findings suggest there's an argument to be made for electing to use African American, though one can't help but get the sense that it's a decision that papers over the urgency of continued progress.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Few political libraries are without a copy of Nudge: Improving Decisions About Health, Wealth and Happiness, by Richard Thaler and Cass Sunstein.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And if we're not going to make rational decisions about the future, others may have to help us to do so.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: "By taking upon the role of adviser rather than decision maker, one does not suffer the consequences of decision fatigue," he says.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: "It's been hard not to share pictures of her because people always want to know how babies and toddler (学走路的孩子) are doing and to see pictures, but we made the decision to have social media while she did not," O'Hanlon said.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: "Research has found that women negotiate higher salaries for others than they do for themselves," he says, adding that people slip in and out of decision roles.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: "When people experience decision fatigue—when they are tired of making choices—they have a tendency to choose to go with the status quo 现状," he says.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: And he has a theory of love that argues that it's made up of three components: intimacy,passion and commitment, or what is sometimes called decision commitment.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: But decision fatigue goes away when you are making the decision for someone else.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: But put a deadline on the input stage and arrive at a decision, even if it's a decision that doesn't have consensus.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Hall's findings suggest there's an argument to be made for electing to use "African American", though one can't help but get the sense that it's a decision that papers over the urgency of continued progress.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: If you've ever started a sentence with, "If I were you…" or found yourself scratching your head at a colleague's agony over a decision when the answer is crystal-clear, there's a scientific reason behind it.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It will decide on the Weddell Sea sanctuary proposal at a conference in Australia in October, although a decision on the peninsula sanctuary is not expected until later.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Morgan said those findings—which included data from the system's 13 community colleges, 27 technical colleges and six universities—were part of the decision not to move forward with Governor Bill Haslam's proposal to privatize management of state building
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: People who are susceptible to decision fatigue will likely choose to do nothing over something, he says.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Research has found that women negotiate higher salaries for others than they do for themselves, he says, adding that people slip in and out of decision roles.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Some people are too subordinate to others' opinions, too focused on decision consensus, too silent about their own point of view, too agreeable to take things on when they don't have time or energy.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Tennessee's technical and community colleges will not outsource management of their facilities to a private company, a decision one leader said was bolstered by ananalysis of spending at each campus.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: That's not to say that risk is always good, but it is related to taking action, whereas decision fatigue assuredly leads to inaction and the possible chagrin of a decision maker who might otherwise prefer a new course but is unfortunately hindered.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The problem is "decision fatigue, '' a psychological phenomenon that takes a toll on the quality of your choices after a long day of decision making, says Evan Polman, a leading psychologist.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The third element of love in Sternberg's theory is what he calls decision commitment, the decision that one is in a love relationship, the willingness to label it as such and the commitment to maintain that relationship at least for some period of time.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: When people imagine themselves as advisers and imagine their own choices as belonging to someone else, they feel less tired and rely less on decision shortcuts to make those choices.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: When we're too collaborative, we want everyone to agree with a decision before we proceed.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"决定，决心"之意。
means: resolution ： 指自觉地正式表示的决心，含极强的主观能动意味。
decision ： 既可指重大的或一般的决定或决心，又可指在多种情况下作出果断的抉择，毫不犹豫地采取行动。
determination ： 侧重坚定不移的顽强意志力。
resolve ： 语气较强，强调克服感情上的软弱，下决心干具体的一件事。

stems_affixes.word_buile: insect昆虫+cide切开,杀→杀虫的[东西]

Sentence.sentence: A recent trend has been to encourage employees to use their own initiative, to make decisions on their own without asking managers first.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: And at that moment, I made the decision: I will develop and follow a personal growth plan for my life.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Boldness means a decision to bite off more than you are sure you can eat.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But good news is that there're really only three kinds of decisions you need to make about color in your home: the small ones, the medium ones, and the large ones.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Finally, after more than an hour in the dark and the icy cold, simon had to make a decision.

means.word_mean: 决定, 决心, 判断

sentences.en: Several unpopular decisions diminished the governor's popularity.
sentences.cn: 几项不得人心的决定使州长的声望下降。

sentences.en: The voice firmed with decision.
sentences.cn: 嗓音变得果断坚定。

means.word_mean: (对问题、疑问、争端等的)决定，解决；选定
【体育】(任何运动比赛或竞赛的)最终比分
【拳击】判定获胜(按得分或各裁判员意见判定胜负)

sentences.en: Tyson decisioned his opponent by a point score rather than a knockout.
sentences.cn: 泰森靠判定而不是靠击倒对手获胜。</seg>

expand_knowledge_list.cn: 优柔寡断的，犹豫不决的

entry.def: When you make a decision, you choose what should be done or which is the best of various possible actions.

example.ex: A decision was taken to discipline Marshall...
example.tran: 已作出对马歇尔进行处罚的决定。

example.ex: The president said he'd made no firm decision on whether he would run for a second term in office...
example.tran: 总统说他还没有下定决心是否竞选连任。

entry.def: Decision is the act of deciding something or the need to decide something.

example.ex: The moment of decision cannot be delayed...
example.tran: 作出决定的时刻由不得耽搁。

example.ex: This was a matter for decision by the individual.
example.tran: 这件事需要个人自己决定。

entry.def: Decision is the ability to decide quickly and definitely what to do.

example.ex: He is very much a man of decision and action.
example.tran: 他是一个遇事非常果断、行动极为迅速的人。

means.word_mean: 1. a position or opinion or judgment reached after consideration;

sentences.sentence: "his conclusion took the evidence into account"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of making up your mind about something;
3. (boxing) a victory won on points when no knockout has occurred;

sentences.sentence: "had little trouble in taking a unanimous decision over his opponent"

means.word_mean: 4. the outcome of a game or contest;

sentences.sentence: "the team dropped three decisions in a row"

means.word_mean: 5. the trait of resoluteness as evidenced by firmness of character or purpose;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin decisio(n-), from decidere 'determine' (see decide)

sentences.cn: 作出决定
sentences.en: (British English)to take a decision (= to decide)

sentences.cn: 作出决定
sentences.en: to make a decision (= to decide)

sentences.cn: 我们得在下周前就这一问题作出决定。
sentences.en: We need a decision on this by next week.

sentences.cn: 是谁决定继续这项工程的？
sentences.en: Who took the decision to go ahead with the project?

sentences.cn: 他的确不善于决策。
sentences.en: He is really bad at making decisions .

sentences.cn: 我们终于作出了抉择。
sentences.en: We finally reached a decision (= decided after some difficulty) .

sentences.cn: 我们必须最晚明天就下一步做什么作出决定。
sentences.en: We must come to a decision about what to do next by tomorrow.

sentences.cn: 一项重大的抉择
sentences.en: a big (= an important) decision

sentences.cn: 最终的决定权属于你。
sentences.en: The final decision is yours.

sentences.cn: 这对任何医生来说都是一个困难的决定。
sentences.en: It's a difficult decision for any doctor.

sentences.cn: 编辑定了就不再改了。
sentences.en: The editor's decision is final.

sentences.cn: 家里的事玛丽说了算。
sentences.en: Mary is the decision-maker in the house.

sentences.cn: 不果断的人不适宜做这工作。
sentences.en: This is not a job for someone who lacks decision.

sentences.cn: 决策的时刻已经到了。
sentences.en: The moment of decision had arrived.

sentences.cn: 已作出对马歇尔进行处罚的决定。

sentences.en: The decision was taken by acclamation.

sentences.en: With respect to your other proposals, I am not yet able to tell you our decision.

sentences.cn: 我们对他的决定感到遗憾.
sentences.en: We feel regretful to his decision.

sentences.en: Don't be rash in making your decision.
